items.title: Urbanizing China
items.abstract: The urbanization plan is intriguing, but the government needs to make sure its ideas are carried out in ways that benefit its people.

items.title: The Price of China’s Haphazard Urbanization
items.abstract: Migrants’ struggles reflect an urban-planning crisis: Chinese cities have grown too big, too quickly.

items.title: Rockville Centre, L.I., an Urbanized Suburb
items.abstract: The once-sleepy village of Rockville Centre, in southwest Nassau County, is becoming more walkable and workable through an ongoing “smart growth” program.

items.title: Q. and A.: Jeremy Wallace on China’s Rush to Urbanize
items.abstract: The author discusses how China has avoided the instability that urbanization has brought to many other countries around the world.

items.title: In China's Urbanization, Worries of a Housing Shortage
items.abstract: The clearance of so-called villages within cities removes cheap housing stock for the very people chosen to fuel migration, without providing sufficient replacement units.
